page.title: 19THE NAZE TOWER
page.content: The Naze Tower has six windows and was built in 1720 by Trinity House to provide a landmark for boats.It is 82 feet or 25.70 metres high with 6 floors and a seventh floor and a roof reached by a ladder.The tower stands on the highest point of the headland, 162 feet above the high water level.It is 100 metres from the cliff top and the circumference of the tower measures 18.87 metres.Near the Naze Tower on the beach are two pill boxes they were built from 1938-39.As the cliffs have been eroded over the years the pill boxes have slipped down the cliffs and are now 71 metres from the cliff top.
